content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following interconnected entities:
- Burner Inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) deployed at the factory interface.
- Burner Inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5) (retrieved and used as a connection point).
- Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(2.5, 17.5) serving as the resource inlet.
- Assembling Machine at Position(1.5, 19.5) receiving items for copper cable production.

### Depot Belt System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities arranged for isolating belt connections:
- Wooden Chest (belt depot) at Position(3.5, 15.5) crafted and successfully placed.
- Transport Belt Segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) positioned adjacent to the depot chest.
- Depot Burner Inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) installed to interface with incoming items.

ERROR TIPS

• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 - When attempting to connect transport belts, the target was repeatedly misinterpreted as a Prototype.SteamEngine.  
 - Use an inserter that feeds into the steam engine instead of directly targeting it for all belt connections.

• Entity Placement Distance Error  
 - A wooden chest placement failed because the target location (3.5, 15.5) was too far from the player’s (0, 0) position.  
 - Move closer to the intended placement position to satisfy the maximum distance requirement.

• Inventory Shortage Error  
 - Placement of the wooden chest later failed due to the item not being present in the inventory.  
 - Verify that the necessary entity is available before attempting placement.

• Variable Reference Error  
 - An undefined variable (‘target_chest’) was referenced, resulting in a NameError.  
 - Ensure all variables are correctly defined and referenced to avoid such errors.
